reporter_caption.center: MANELL v. S.S. KRESGE COMPANY, 302 Mass. 601 (1939)

caption.center: GEORGIA E. MANELL vs. S.S. KRESGE COMPANY.

opinion.opinion_text: Exceptions overruled. The verdict for the defendant was directed rightly. The evidence did not warrant a finding of negligence on the part of the defendant, its officers, agents or servants. There was no error in the exclusion of evidence.
opinion.attorneys:
T.B. Shea, for the plaintiff.
K.C. Parker, for the defendant.
